channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What to Know About Honduras’s Elections
item.description: President Trump has put a spotlight on Honduras as voters head to the polls. Their choices include the left-wing party in power and a candidate endors...

item.title: Suspect in National Guard attack had been unraveling for years while alternating between ‘dark isolation and reckless travel’
item.description: Sometimes, he spent weeks in his “darkened room, not speaking to anyone, not even his wife or older kids.”

item.title: Trump says Venezuelan airspace should be viewed as closed amid largest buildup of U.S. firepower in the region in generations
item.description: The statement also said that U.S. immigration authorities had unilaterally suspended biweekly deportation flights of Venezuelan migrants.

item.title: Trump administration halts all asylum decisions and pauses issuing visas for people with Afghan passports
item.description: The Republican administration is promising to pause entry to the United States from some poor nations and review Afghans and other legal migrants alre...

item.title: Glenn Close, Ethan Hawke and Others Mourn Tom Stoppard
item.description: Nobody advanced or cherished the English language more than Stoppard, Tim Curry noted. Colleagues and fans agreed.

item.title: Mamdani, a Sharp Critic of Police Surveillance, Will Soon Oversee It
item.description: Zohran Mamdani, New York’s mayor-elect, has criticized the N.Y.P.D.’s surveillance tactics. He reappointed the police commissioner who helped create a...

item.title: Swiss voters reject tax of up to 50% on large donations or inheritances, fearing exodus of wealthy instead of fighting climate change
item.description: The revenues were to be used to fight the impact of climate change and help Switzerland meet its ambitions to have net-zero greenhouse gas emissions b...

item.title: Netanyahu Asks Israel’s President to Pardon Him in Corruption Cases
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu made the contentious appeal weeks after President Trump had made the same request to the Israeli president.

item.title: The $124 trillion Great Wealth Transfer won’t be a ‘big bang’ warns Northwestern Mutual CEO Tim Gerend
item.description: Women live longer than men, and wealth will transfer across spouses before it moves from baby boomers to the next generation.

item.title: The Shocking Crash That Led Marin County to Reckon With the Dangers of E-Bikes
item.description: Unregulated e-bikes are a growing danger on American streets. In one Bay Area town, a terrible accident finally led to reform.

item.title: Lebanon’s Christians Look to Pope Leo’s Visit for a Message of Hope and Peace
item.description: The pontiff met political leaders upon his arrival on Sunday and will later say Mass at a Beirut port destroyed by an explosion five years ago.

item.title: Netanyahu Asks Israel’s President to Pardon Him in Corruption Cases
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu made the contentious appeal weeks after President Trump had made the same request to the Israeli president.

item.title: Hong Kong’s Migrant Domestic Workers Mourn Their Losses in Deadly Fire
item.description: At least eight workers died, and many of those who survived, after saving children and others in their care, are worried about losing their jobs and b...

item.title: What to Know About Honduras’s Elections
item.description: President Trump has put a spotlight on Honduras as voters head to the polls. Their choices include the left-wing party in power and a candidate endors...

item.title: Pope Leo Calls for a Two-State Solution in Mideast Conflict
item.description: The pope, en route to Lebanon after visiting Turkey, said he had discussed with the Turkish president how the Vatican might help Israel and the Palest...
